expression_380.example:
A: Yo, you still coming through to the party tonight?
B: Nah, I gotta stay in. My sister's visiting and I put my family first.
A: Respect. I didn't know the fam was in town.
B: Yeah, we don't get to see each other much, so it's a must.
A: For sure. Family always comes first no matter what.
B: Facts. Catch you later this week though?

expression_381.primary: I could get the most out of it.
similar: I squeezed every drop out of it.
I made the most of the situation.
I utilized it to the fullest.
expression_381.example:
A: How was that internship you did over the summer?
B: It was solid. I really felt like I could get the most out of it.
A: That's dope. Did you get to work on any big projects?
B: Yeah, they let me lead a small team. It was a huge learning curve.
A: I'm glad you didn't let that opportunity go to waste.
B: No way. I was definitely trying to level up.

expression_382.primary: Sometimes we don't see eye to eye.
similar: We're not on the same page sometimes.
We bump heads every now and then.
expression_382.example:
A: You and your roommate still good?
B: Yeah, we're fine, but sometimes we don't see eye to eye on the chores.
A: I feel you. Living with people is a constant adjustment.
B: For real. He thinks the dishes can wait, and I'm like 'nope'.
A: As long as you guys can talk it out, it's whatever.
B: Facts. We just gotta find that middle ground.

expression_383.primary: If everything goes according to plan.
similar: If things pan out as expected.
expression_383.example:
A: When are you officially moving into the new spot?
B: If everything goes according to plan, I'll be there by Friday.
A: That's a quick turnaround. You all packed yet?
B: Almost. Just a few more boxes and I'm good to go.
A: Dope. Let me know if you need a hand with the heavy lifting.
B: Shot. I'll definitely hit you up.

expression_384.primary: You're more than welcome to stay.
similar: We'd love to have you stay.
The door's always open for you.
expression_384.example:
A: It's getting late. I should probably head out.
B: Honestly, you're more than welcome to stay if you don't wanna drive.
A: You sure? I don't wanna overstay my welcome.
B: Not at all. We've got extra space, so it's chill.
A: I really appreciate that. I am pretty beat.
B: Say less. I'll grab some extra blankets for you.

expression_385.example:
A: Do you think this duct tape is enough for the leak?
B: Yeah, it will do the trick until the plumber gets here.
A: Hope so. I don't want the kitchen floor to turn into a pool.
B: It's just a temporary fix, so don't stress too much.
A: True. I'll keep an eye on it just in case.
B: Smart move. Let's just pray it holds.

expression_386.primary: Once you get the hang of it, it's pretty easy.
similar: Once you catch on, it's a breeze.
It's simple once you find your rhythm.
You'll get it down in no time.
It's all about that learning curve.
expression_386.example:
A: This editing software is so confusing, I'm about to quit.
B: Chill. Once you get the hang of it, it's pretty easy.
A: Easy for you to say. You've been doing this for years.
B: Trust me, it was a struggle for me at first too.
A: Alright, show me that shortcut again.
B: See? Once it clicks, you'll be flying through these edits.

expression_387.primary: As far as that is concerned.
expression_387.example:
A: Are we still worried about the budget for the event?
B: As far as that is concerned, we're actually in the clear.
A: Oh word? Did we get that extra sponsorship?
B: Yeah, they confirmed this morning. We've got more than enough.
A: That's a huge weight off my shoulders.
B: Definitely. Now we can finally focus on the actual content.

similar: I turned to him for help.
expression_388.example:
A: How did you get through that rough patch last year?
B: Honestly, I leaned on him a lot. He was always there.
A: It's good to have someone like that in your corner.
B: Facts. I don't think I could've handled it alone.
A: He's a real one for sure.
B: 100%. I'm forever grateful for his support.

expression_389.example:
A: Hey, we're all grabbing drinks after work. You in?
B: I'd love to, but I'm swamped. I'll take a rain check.
A: No worries. We'll definitely do it again soon.
B: For sure. Have a round for me though.
A: You got it. Don't work too hard!
B: I'll try not to. Catch you tomorrow.

expression_390.primary: How did your summer project go?
similar: Did the summer project turn out well?
How'd the project go over the summer?
What's the status of your summer project?
How did that summer thing end up?
expression_390.example:
A: Long time no see! How did your summer project go?
B: It went surprisingly well. We actually finished ahead of schedule.
A: That's impressive. What was the main focus again?
B: We were building a community garden in Brooklyn.
A: Dope. I'd love to come check it out sometime.
B: Definitely. It's looking really good now.

expression_391.primary: I ended up becoming an English teacher.
similar: I turned out to be an English teacher.
I eventually became an English teacher.
Fate led me to teaching English.
I landed a job as an English teacher.
I found my path as an English teacher.
expression_391.example:
A: I didn't know you studied literature in college!
B: Yeah, and after a few odd jobs, I ended up becoming an English teacher.
A: That's awesome. Do you enjoy working with the kids?
B: Most of the time, yeah. It's definitely rewarding.
A: I bet. You always were good at explaining things.
B: Thanks. It feels like where I'm supposed to be.

expression_392.example:
A: I'm really struggling to keep up with these emails.
B: Don't worry about it. I'll take over for the rest of the day.
A: Are you sure? You've got your own stuff to do.
B: I'm caught up on my work, so it's no biggie.
A: You're a lifesaver. I really need a break.
B: Take fifteen. I've got this under control.

expression_393.example:
A: Can we move our meeting to 3 PM instead of 1?
B: Yeah, it works for me. I've got a gap then.
A: Great. I'll update the calendar invite right now.
B: Perfect. Should we meet in the usual conference room?
A: Yeah, let's do that. See you then!
B: Sounds like a plan. Catch you later.

expression_394.primary: I'll take one for the team.
similar: I'll step up for the group.
I'll do it for the squad.
I'll bear the brunt for us.
expression_394.example:
A: Someone needs to stay late and finish this report.
B: Honestly, I'll take one for the team and do it. Everyone else has plans.
A: You're a legend. We'll definitely make it up to you.
B: It's whatever. I didn't have much going on tonight anyway.
A: We'll buy you lunch tomorrow for sure.
B: Say less. I'm holding you to that!

expression_395.primary: I'll keep you posted on that.
similar: I'll let you know what happens.
I'll stay in touch about it.
I'll give you the lowdown later.
I'll keep you in the loop.
expression_395.example:
A: Any news on the job interview yet?
B: Not yet, but I'll keep you posted on that as soon as I hear back.
A: Fingers crossed for you! You definitely deserve it.
B: Thanks, fam. I'm trying not to overthink it.
A: Just keep doing your thing. The right offer will come.
B: Facts. I'll hit you up as soon as the phone rings.

expression_396.example:
A: I tried to match the paint, but it's a tiny bit darker.
B: Honestly? That's close enough. No one's gonna notice.
A: You sure? It's bothering me a little bit.
B: Trust me, once the furniture is back, it'll blend right in.
A: Alright, if you say so. I'm done for today then.
B: Facts. Let's just grab some pizza and call it a win.

expression_397.primary: It's worth doing the right thing.
similar: The right path is always the best path.
expression_397.example:
A: I could've just kept the extra change the cashier gave me.
B: But you gave it back. It's worth doing the right thing, you know?
A: Yeah, I would've felt guilty if I didn't.
B: Exactly. Good karma always comes back around.
A: For sure. I feel much better now.
B: That's the spirit. Integrity is key.

expression_398.primary: I'll take that as a compliment.
similar: I'll take that as a win.
I'll assume you meant that nicely.
expression_398.example:
A: You're so stubborn when it comes to your art.
B: Haha, I'll take that as a compliment. I'm just passionate.
A: I meant it in a good way, actually. Your focus is crazy.
B: Thanks. I really try to be intentional with everything I create.
A: It definitely shows in the final product.
B: I appreciate that. Means a lot coming from you.

similar: I'll jump on it right now.
expression_399.example:
A: Can you fix that typo on the website before the client sees it?
B: Oh snap, I'll get right on it. Good catch!
A: No sweat. I just happened to notice it while browsing.
B: It should be fixed in like two minutes.
A: Perfect. Let me know when it's live.
B: Done. Check it out now.

similar: It's back to its original state.
expression_400.example:
A: Did you manage to fix that cracked screen?
B: Yeah, look at it. It's as good as new.
A: Wow, I can't even see where the crack was.
B: The repair shop did a solid job. Worth every penny.
A: No cap. It looks like you just bought it.
B: For real. I'm definitely going back there if I break it again.

expression_401.primary: They have a lot in common.
similar: They have a lot of similarities.
They're two peas in a pod.
expression_401.example:
A: Have you met my new coworkers? They're hilarious.
B: Yeah, I noticed they have a lot in common. Both are into retro games.
A: Facts. They've been talking about old-school Nintendo all day.
B: It's good they hit it off so quickly.
A: For sure. Makes the office vibe a lot more chill.
B: Definitely. Team chemistry is everything.

expression_402.example:
A: I decided to volunteer at the animal shelter again this weekend.
B: Haha, that's typical of you. Always trying to help out.
A: I just can't say no to those cute faces, you know?
B: I know. You've always had a big heart.
A: I guess it's just my thing.
B: It's a good thing. Don't ever change.

expression_403.example:
A: I'm heading out for my trip tomorrow morning.
B: Safe travels! Make sure you look after yourself while you're away.
A: I will. I've got my vitamins and my itinerary all set.
B: Good. Don't push yourself too hard, just enjoy the vibe.
A: Thanks, fam. I'll hit you up when I land.
B: Sounds good. Peace out!

expression_404.example:
A: I'm thinking about starting my own podcast, but I'm nervous.
B: Honestly? Go for it! You've got so many interesting stories to tell.
A: You really think people would listen?
B: 100%. Your perspective is unique, and that's what matters.
A: Alright, I'm gonna start recording this weekend.
B: That's what I'm talking about! I'll be your first listener.

expression_405.example:
A: Did you hear what the new manager did this morning?
B: Ugh, yeah. Honestly, he's a piece of work. Always micromanaging.
A: It's getting really old, really fast.
B: Facts. I don't know how much longer I can deal with it.
A: Hopefully he chills out once he's settled in.
B: I wouldn't hold my breath. He seems set in his ways.

expression_406.example:
A: I'm trusting you with this big account. Don't mess it up.
B: I won't let you down, I promise. I've been preparing for this.
A: I know you have. I believe in your skills.
B: Thanks for the opportunity. I'm gonna give it 110%.
A: That's the energy I like to see.
B: I'll have the first draft ready by tomorrow morning.

expression_407.primary: I've been trying to reach you.
similar: I've been trying to get ahold of you.
I've been blowing up your phone.
I've been trying to connect with you.
I was trying to find you.
expression_407.example:
A: Yo, I missed like five calls from you! What's up?
B: Man, I've been trying to reach you all day! Where were you?
A: My phone was on silent during the movie. My bad.
B: All good. Anyway, we're all meeting at the pizza spot in ten.
A: Say less. I'm leaving right now.
B: Bet. See you there.

expression_408.primary: It was a stroke of luck.
expression_408.example:
A: How did you find such a great apartment in this market?
B: Honestly, it was a stroke of luck. I saw the listing five minutes after it went up.
A: That's insane. Most spots are gone in an hour.
B: For real. I signed the lease before anyone else even toured it.
A: You definitely used up all your luck for the year on that one.
B: Facts. But honestly? Totally worth it.

expression_409.example:
A: You've been really quiet lately. Is everything alright?
B: I'm just stressed, I guess. It's no big deal.
A: Look, don't bottle up your feelings. It's better to talk about it.
B: I just don't wanna bother anyone with my problems.
A: You're not bothering me. That's what friends are for.
B: Thanks. Maybe I do need to vent a little.

expression_410.primary: It is hard to come by.
expression_410.example:
A: Where did you find that vintage leather jacket?
B: At a small thrift shop upstate. Pieces like this are hard to come by.
A: The quality is incredible. They really don't make them like this anymore.
B: For real. I was shocked it was even in my size.
A: You definitely scored big time.
B: Facts. I'm never letting this one go.

similar: I'm starting to appreciate you more.
expression_411.example:
A: I know I'm a bit much sometimes, but I mean well.
B: Don't worry about it. Honestly? You're growing on me.
A: Oh, really? I thought I was annoying you.
B: You were at first, but now I think you're just hilarious.
A: I'll take that as a win.
B: As you should. Let's get some coffee.

similar: I worked late into the night.
I put in extra hours at night.
expression_412.example:
A: You look exhausted. Did you actually get any sleep?
B: Barely. I burnt the midnight oil to finish that presentation.
A: Was it worth it? Hope the client liked it.
B: They loved it. All that effort really paid off.
A: Good to hear, but you should definitely crash early tonight.
B: 100%. My brain is officially fried.

similar: Don't be so hard on me.
expression_413.example:
A: You're ten minutes late again. This is becoming a habit.
B: Look, cut me some slack. The subway was a complete mess today.
A: I know, but you gotta plan for that.
B: I did! There was an unexpected delay. I'm doing my best.
A: Alright, just try to be more punctual from now on.
B: I got you. I'll leave even earlier tomorrow.

expression_414.primary: That would be the best case scenario.
similar: If everything goes right, that's what happens.
expression_414.example:
A: If we launch by Monday, we'll beat all our competitors.
B: That would be the best case scenario. Everyone's working overtime.
A: Do you think we can actually make it happen?
B: It's a tight squeeze, but it's definitely possible.
A: Fingers crossed. This would be huge for the team.
B: For real. Let's just keep this momentum going.

expression_415.example:
A: New York is honestly the best city for inspiration.
B: I couldn't agree more. The energy here is just different.
A: For real. Everywhere you look, there's someone doing something creative.
B: It's like you can't help but feel motivated.
A: Facts. I never want to live anywhere else.
B: Same. This city is just in my blood.

expression_416.primary: I've got a memory like a sieve.
similar: My brain is like a blank slate sometimes.
expression_416.example:
A: Did you remember to pick up the milk on your way home?
B: Oh snap! I completely forgot. I've got a memory like a sieve.
A: I literally texted you ten minutes ago!
B: I know, I know. I saw it and then immediately got distracted.
A: It's all good, I'll just go grab it now.
B: My bad, fam. I'll make it up to you.

expression_417.example:
A: Wait, I didn't see this appetizer on the bill.
B: Don't worry about it, it's on the house. Thanks for coming in tonight!
A: Oh, that's so sweet! Thank you so much.
B: Of course. You guys are regulars, we gotta show some love.
A: We really appreciate that. The food was incredible as always.
B: Glad you enjoyed it! See you next time.

expression_418.primary: I think you should get a second opinion.
expression_418.example:
A: The mechanic says my car needs a whole new engine.
B: That sounds extreme. I think you should get a second opinion.
A: You're right. I don't really trust that guy anyway.
B: Take it to my guy in Queens. He's honest and won't overcharge you.
A: Good looks. I'll give him a call tomorrow.
B: Definitely. Better safe than sorry.

similar: You're at the top of your game.
expression_419.example:
A: I really appreciate all the help you've given me with this project.
B: Any time! Honestly, your work ethic is second to none.
A: Wow, thanks. I really try to put in the effort.
B: It shows. You're easily the most dedicated person on the team.
A: That means a lot coming from you.
B: Facts. Just keep doing what you're doing.

expression_420.example:
A: Guess what? I just won a thousand dollars on a scratch-off!
B: No way! Don't pull my leg, show me the ticket.
A: I'm dead serious! Look right here.
B: Oh my god, you actually did it! That's insane!
A: I know! I'm still in shock.
B: Drinks are definitely on you tonight then!

expression_421.example:
A: You said you were gonna confront him, so what happened?
B: I... I don't know. I just couldn't say it.
A: What, cat got your tongue? You were so brave yesterday.
B: It's different when you're actually looking at them, okay?
A: I get it, but you gotta stand up for yourself eventually.
B: I will. I just need a different approach.

expression_422.example:
A: I think we should skip the launch and just start a new project from scratch.
B: Honestly? You have lost the plot. We're 90% done!
A: I just feel like the market has changed, you know?
B: In three months? No way. We need to finish what we started.
A: Maybe you're right. I'm just feeling a bit overwhelmed.
B: Take a breather. We're almost at the finish line.

expression_423.primary: Let's just keep it between us.
similar: Just between the two of us.
expression_423.example:
A: I'm planning on quitting my job next month.
B: Oh wow! Have you told anyone else yet?
A: No, so let's just keep it between us for now.
B: Of course. Your secret is safe with me.
A: I appreciate that. I just want everything to be in place first.
B: Smart move. Let me know if I can help with anything.

expression_424.example:
A: Alright, we've got another big shipment coming in tomorrow.
B: Got it. You know the drill, I'll be here early to organize everything.
A: Good looks. I'll handle the documentation then.
B: Sounds like a plan. We'll be done by lunch if we move fast.
A: For sure. Let's get it.
B: Catch you in the morning.

expression_425.primary: It's been a roller coaster ride.
similar: There have been many ups and downs.
expression_425.example:
A: How has the first year of your startup been?
B: Honestly, it's been a roller coaster ride. Some days are great, some are stressful.
A: I can imagine. Entrepreneurship is no joke.
B: For real. But I'm learning a lot through all the chaos.
A: That's the best way to grow though.
B: Facts. I wouldn't trade it for anything.

expression_426.example:
A: I really look up to you, especially how you handle difficult clients.
B: Wow, thank you! I appreciate that a lot.
A: No, seriously. You're always so calm and professional.
B: It took years of practice, trust me. I used to be so stressed.
A: Well, you're killing it now.
B: Thanks, fam. That means more than you know.

similar: It doesn't live up to the hype.
expression_427.example:
A: Everyone's talking about that new brunch spot in SoHo. Have you been?
B: Yeah, and honestly? It's overrated. Food was mid at best.
A: Oh really? The pictures look so good though.
B: It's all for the aesthetic. The actual taste just isn't there.
A: Good to know. I'll save my money for somewhere else.
B: Definitely. There are way better spots for half the price.

expression_428.primary: It was a blessing in disguise.
similar: It was a fortunate turn of events.
It turned out for the better.
expression_428.example:
A: I was so devastated when I didn't get that first job offer.
B: But you ended up with a way better one! It was a blessing in disguise.
A: Accurate. This company has a much better culture and pay.
B: See? Life has a funny way of working itself out.
A: For sure. I'm much happier here.
B: I'm glad to hear it. Onwards and upwards!

similar: I'm not one to hold onto things.
expression_429.example:
A: I'm really sorry about what I said during the argument yesterday.
B: Don't worry about it. I don't hold a grudge. We're good.
A: Thanks, I was really worried you'd be mad for a while.
B: Life is too short for all that negativity. Let's just move forward.
A: I appreciate that. You're a real one.
B: Facts. Let's grab some lunch and put it behind us.
